result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney L Harding was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transfered to another County or State
Early discharge at recommendations of agent if obligations fulfilled

miscConds.notes: Misdemeanor Costs entered in error.  Corrected to include Felony costs.
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia  Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate
Sign releases for any medical providers 
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

records.addlTxt: State appears by ADA Urmanski-Deft. appears in custody with Atty. Rael-Deft. enters NC plea to charge-Advised of rights-Victim addresses the Court-Recommendations of counsel-Deft. addresses the Court-950 complied with
Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Rael. Request to Amend Bond, State objects. Denied by the Court.
Defendant's Notice of Motion & Motion to Modify Bond
Defendant's demand for discovery and inspection.

Def appeared in custody with Attorney Rael.  
Probable cause found to bind over for trial.
Information filed.  Not guilty plea entered.
Motion to dismiss denied by the court.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions:   No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property,   Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia,   Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional,   Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages,   Pick up personal belongings with police escort.

Deft appeared in custody, via video w/Atty Van Kerkvoored. Received complaint, reading waived. Advised of rights.
Preliminary hearing requested. dlm
